quote: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
Mindfulness isn’t difficult, we just need to remember to do it.
The present moment is the only time over which we have dominion.
You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
Wherever you are, be there totally.
The mind is everything. What you think you become.
Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
You are the sky. Everything else is just the weather.
Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.
The body benefits from movement, and the mind benefits from stillness.
In today’s rush, we all think too much—seek too much—want too much—and forget about the joy of just being.
The mind is like water. When it’s turbulent, it’s difficult to see. When it’s calm, everything becomes clear.
To meditate is to discover new possibilities, to awaken the capacity each of us has to live more wisely, more lovingly, more compassionately, and more fully.
The soul always knows what to do to heal itself. The challenge is to silence the mind.
Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence.
Life is available only in the present moment.
Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking out new landscapes but in having new eyes.
Awareness is the greatest agent for change.
The real meditation is how you live your life.
In silence there is eloquence. Stop weaving and watch how the pattern improves.
The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
The mind is a wonderful servant but a terrible master.
Drink your tea slowly and reverently, as if it is the axis on which the world revolves.
Forever is composed of nows.
The best way to capture moments is to pay attention. This is how we cultivate mindfulness.
If you want to conquer the anxiety of life, live in the moment, live in the breath.
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
Mindfulness is the aware, balanced acceptance of the present experience.
The little things? The little moments? They aren’t little.
Every breath we take, every step we make, can be filled with peace, joy, and serenity.
The art of mindfulness begins with noticing the beauty in ordinary moments.
When you own your breath, nobody can steal your peace.
The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
Mindfulness is the antidote to the distracted, chaotic world we live in.
The mind that opens to a new idea never returns to its original size.
Everything is created twice. First in the mind and then in reality.
No matter how difficult the past, you can always begin again today.
The more you rest in awareness, the more life becomes a dance of effortless ease.
The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn the past, worry about the future, but to live in the present moment wisely and earnestly.
Be where you are; otherwise you will miss your life.
Mindfulness helps you go home to the present. And every time you go there and recognize a condition of happiness that you have, happiness comes.
The present moment is the only moment available to us, and it is the door to all moments.
Attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity.
The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
When you do something, you should burn yourself completely, like a good bonfire, leaving no trace of yourself.
The practice of mindfulness is the practice of remembering.
To meditate is to be silent, to listen, and to open yourself to the truth of life.
The essence of mindfulness is to wake up, to recognize what is actually here.
Mindfulness is the gentle power that helps you stop being a prisoner of old habits.
The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
To be mindful is to be in constant communion with the universe.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
The more you practice the art of stillness, the more you hear the whispers of the universe.
Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
The only way to make sense out of life is to see it as a journey of awakening.
The real secret of life—to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now.
Pure awareness transcends thinking. It allows you to step outside the chattering negative self-talk and your reactive impulses and emotions.
We use mindfulness to observe the way we cling to pleasant experiences & push away unpleasant ones.
If you want to know your own mind, observe and recognize everything about it during your day-to-day life.
The wound is the place where the light enters you.
Abundance is not something we acquire. It is something we tune into.
The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
The only way to live is by accepting each minute as an unrepeatable miracle.
Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against challenges.
Do every act of your life as though it were the last act of your life.
Leave your front door and back door open. Let your thoughts come and go; just don’t serve them tea.
Be here now.
When you are present, the world is truly alive.
The more you are motivated by love, the more fearless and free your actions will be.
The real meditation is how you live your life.
Within you, there is a stillness and a sanctuary to which you can retreat at any time and be yourself.
As you breathe in, imagine you are in a fragrant garden of roses.
If you aren’t in the moment, you are either looking forward to uncertainty or back to pain and regret.
The still waters of a lake reflect the beauty around it. When the mind is still, the beauty of the self is reflected.
Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes ... including you.
The mind is a flexible mirror; adjust it to see a better world.
Training your mind to be in the present moment is the number one key to making healthier choices.
Life is a dance between making it happen and letting it happen.
If you think you're enlightened, go spend a week with your family.
Suffering is part of our training program for becoming wise.
Reality is only an agreement – today is always today.
The significance is hiding in the insignificant. Appreciate everything.
The Universe has our back, yes, and our heart. The Universe has our heart.
If the mind is quiet, we come to know ourselves as the pure witness.
You need nothing more, just remember that you are the witness only.
The ‘person’ is merely the result of a misunderstanding.
Let go of your mind and then be mindful. Close your ears and listen!
Everything that has a beginning has an ending. Make your peace with that and all will be well.
Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
A mind set in its ways is wasted.
When you focus on the good, the good gets better.
The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.
If it’s out of your hands, it deserves freedom from your mind too.
The first and best victory is to conquer self.
Slow down, you'll get there faster.
Meditation means dissolving the invisible walls that unawareness has built.
When we get too caught up in the busyness of the world, we lose connection with one another—and ourselves.
Looking at beauty in the world is the first step of purifying the mind.
Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
Remember the blue sky. It may at times be obscured by clouds, but it is always there.
Mindfulness clears the windshield of the mind so that we can see things as they really are.
There is nothing more important to true growth than realizing that you are not the voice of the mind—you are the one who hears it.
Ask yourself: Where am I? Answer: Here. Ask yourself: What time is it? Answer: Now. Say it until you can hear it.
Worrying is stupid. It's like walking around with an umbrella waiting for it to rain.
Live the actual moment. Only this actual moment is life.
